content:
#25264 essentially implements the natural lifts on the left and right that arise from surjective and injective monoid (and mul) homomorphisms.

I think the primary utility here is that it is good to have constructions like this much lower down the import chain.
#25290 and #25296 now exist to implement more things off the basic definitions.

There will probably be future PRs to:

  • Deal with lifts regarding Units.
  • Do something similar with RingHom.
It would be good to understand how to deal with, say, NonUnitalRingHom and the like. Arguably not all of these structures need a lift*! But actually I think most of them do admit such a thing.

It would be helpful to know if anyone can review #25264 again: Eric gave me some feedback but he has seemed busy since. I've confirmed the generalisations I'm aiming for will work.

One thing I need to decide is if I should add definitions for the lifts for NonUnitalRingHom and RingHom in #25264, as I've now worked out how to define them satisfactorily.
